Detailed Description

QueryPath includes a CSS 3 Selector parser.

Typically the parser is not accessed directly. Most developers will use it indirectly from qp(), htmlqp(), or one of the methods on a QueryPath object.

This parser is modular and is not tied to QueryPath, so you can use it in your own (non-QueryPath) projects if you wish. To dive in, start with CssEventHandler, the event interface that works like a SAX API for CSS selectors. If you want to check out the details, check out the parser (CssParser), scanner (CssScanner), and token list (CssToken).
